intro: Velascoa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Velascoa is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. It is considered an invasive species in many areas due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in diverse conditions.
